page.title: 04OX-HAYE FARM
page.content: Ox-Haye farm is in the south-east corner of our study area. It is owned by Mrs. Chadwick who is 89 years old and has lived in the same farm building for over fifty years. The farm itself has fourty-nine acres of land most of which is grazing land. The farm-house is a very impressive building which has changed little in Mrs.Chadwick's time. There is a very large kitchen with stone salting benches which Mrs.Chadwick still uses to salt her bacon. Attached to the farm buildings is a cow shed that is now considered too cramped for modern day use. Mrs.Chadwick states that when she first arrived there was no water supply or bathroom. One of the three bedrooms was later converted to accommodate one.
